metadata.title: CVE-2010-1167 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
fetchmail 4.6.3 through 6.3.16, when debug mode is enabled, does notproperly handle invalid characters in a multi-character locale, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumptionand application crash) via a crafted (1) message header or (2) POP3 UIDLlist.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-1167` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

fetchmail - 6.3.17-4ubuntu1
fetchmailconf - 6.3.17-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fetchmail package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.3.17-4ubuntu1').
